intro: Cacalia liatroides, commonly known as the hairy leaf fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in sunny, open habitats. Its leaves are covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive, fuzzy appearance. Cacalia liatroides produces small yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
